alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Gallatin; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 10:36AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SWITZERLAND, CARROLL, WESTERN OWEN AND GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 AM EDT... At 1035 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Vernon to 10 miles southwest of Madison to 12 miles northwest of La Grange, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Vevay, Warsaw, Owenton, Florence, Kentucky Speedway, Pleasant, Glencoe, Fairview, Ghent, Sanders, Sparta, Patriot, Worthville, Prestonville, Monterey, Gratz, Center Square, Braytown and Interstate 71 at Mile Marker 52. This includes I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 39 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
